subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to get test's name in JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Gabriel -- I can t figure out how to get the test name, short of invoking the test yourself (via the main or something similar).  Sorry. That said, I m very
messageBody:
Gabriel --

I can't figure out how to get the test name, short of invoking the
test yourself (via the "main" or something similar). Sorry.

That said, I'm very curious why you would want to use the test name,
particularly in the manner indicated by your example below. Could you
expand?

--MB


On 1/5/07, gabrielcooper <gabriel.cooper@...> wrote:
>
> public class Example {
> String testName;
>
> @Before
> public void init() {
> // grab the current test's
> // name (i.e. "testSomething", not
> // "Example"), modify it in some
> // uniform way.
> testName = ??
> }
>
> @Test
> public void testSomething() {
> // use testName, and grab the test's (unmodified) name
> // and modify it in some test-specific way
> }
> }
>
>
